definition: one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing heaven/male principle/☰/ancient Chinese compass point: 315° (northwest)

sentences.english: 6But when the sun came up, the plants were scorched, and they withered because they had no root.
sentences.chinese: 日頭出來一曬，因爲沒有根，就枯乾了。

sentences.english: Grass will wither and flowers will fall . But the Word of the Lord will remain forever.
sentences.chinese: 草必枯乾，花必凋謝，惟有主的道是永存的。

sentences.english: But the hand he stretched out toward the man shriveled up, so that he could not pull it back.
sentences.chinese: 王向神人所伸的手就枯乾了，不能彎回。

sentences.english: Let them be as the grass upon the housetops, which withereth afore it groweth up
sentences.chinese: 願他們像房頂上的草，未長成而枯乾。

sentences.english: Whenever the grass was dry the children would cut across me fields instead of keeping to the road.
sentences.chinese: 每當草木枯乾時，孩子們寧走荒野也不去走大路。

sentences.english: And in the morning, as they passed by, they saw the fig tree dried up from the roots.
sentences.chinese: 早晨，他們從那裏經過，看見無花果樹連根都枯乾了。

sentences.english: My heart is blighted and withered like grass; I forget to eat my food.
sentences.chinese: 我的心被傷，如草枯乾，甚至我忘記喫飯。

sentences.english: In the morning it flourisheth, and groweth up; in the evening it is cut down, and withereth.
sentences.chinese: 早晨發芽生長，晚上割下枯乾。

sentences.english: it shall wither in the furrows where it grew.
sentences.chinese: 必在生長的畦中枯乾了。

sentences.english: And presently the fig tree withered away.
sentences.chinese: 那無花果樹就立刻枯乾了。

sentences.english: For ye shall be as an oak whose leaf fadeth, and as a garden that hath no water.
sentences.chinese: 因爲你們必如葉子枯乾的橡樹，好像無水澆灌的園子。

sentences.english: The grass withereth, the flower fadeth: but the word of our God shall stand for ever.
sentences.chinese: 草必枯乾，花必凋殘，唯有我們神的話，必永遠立定。
那無花樹就立刻枯乾了。

sentences.english: For they shall soon be cut down like the grass, and wither as the green herb.
sentences.chinese: 因爲他們如草快被割下，又如青菜快要枯乾。

sentences.english: And when the sun was up, they were scorched; and because they had no root, they withered away.
sentences.chinese: 日頭出來一曬，因爲沒有根，就枯乾了。

definition: (of dry soil, skin etc) to crack/to chap
Silkworms in Spring (1933), Chinese silent movie in socialist realist style, based on novel by Mao Dun 茅盾[Mao2 Dun4]
to be shaded or concealed by foliage/to conceal/hidden/covert/shade (of a tree)
